column4: since by using sudo -i one becomes the root user so any user having an acc on the system can have root access?
only users that are in the sudo group
either in the sudo'ers file or within a group that is given the permission
run this from the terminal `sudo visudo`
thanks , got it but i can't find my username there , is it that i am in a group?
select your user from the list and click manage groups
note that any user that is allowed sudo priveledges is in the "admin" group
but you can also add such admin priveledges and limit them to certain applications or paths in the /etc/sudoers file

oh do you mean the 'root' group? the 'root' group is only used by the 'root' user
there should be a pranay_09 group too, of which only you are a part of
the admin group is what you want, only the actual root account should be given the root group afaik
